inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: seen between 12th and 24th weeks of gestation

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: no multiple pregnancy, obstetric misproportions, previous caesarean, high blood pressure, diabetes, clinical signs of AIDS

inclusion.criterion: staying in a neighbouring district or village
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ability to come for follow-up and delivery
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: no history of recurrent UTI prior to her pregnancy or any other underlying disease

inclusion.criterion: study aims and procedures will be clearly explained
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.label: met

notes: A 25-year-old pregnant woman with fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, dysuria, urgency and frequency. Physical examination reveals tenderness on palpation of both costovertebral angles.
